content.question:
Consider the following spinner, which is used to determine how pieces are to be moved on a game board. Each region is of equal size.

Which of the following code segments can be used to simulate the behavior of the spinner?

choices.label: The figure presents two blocks of code that consists of 8 total lines. Throughout the blocks of code there are nested blocks of code, as follows. Line 1: [begin block] spin  ← RANDOM [begin block] 1, 4 [end block] [end block] [begin block] Line 2: IF [begin block] spin = 1 [end block] [begin block] Line 3: [begin block] color ← “red” [end block] [end block] Line 4:  ELSE [begin block] [begin block] Line 5: IF [begin block] spin = 2 [end block] [begin block] Line 6: [begin block] color ← “blue” [end block] [end block] Line 7: ELSE [begin block] Line 8: [begin block] color ←
